H0.text: Differentiation is the process in which unspecialized cells become specialized in structure and function to perform certain tasks in the body.

H1.text: Speciation is the process in which unspecialized cells become specialized in structure and function to perform certain tasks in the body.

H2.text: Transcription is the process in which unspecialized cells become specialized in structure and function to perform certain tasks in the body.

H3.text: Mutation is the process in which unspecialized cells become specialized in structure and function to perform certain tasks in the body.

A4.text: Cellular differentiation is the process in which a stem cell changes from one type to a differentiated one. Usually, the cell changes to a more specialized type.

A5.text: Differentiation continues in adulthood as adult stem cells divide and create fully differentiated daughter cells during tissue repair and during normal cell turnover.
